intro: Dombeya valimpony f. obovalopsis, commonly known as the oval-leaf dombeya, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically oval-shaped and have a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
